comment.author: 51729007@N02
comment._content: I'm no expert but I think these might actually be black-striped wallabies (note the smallish size, black strip along the spine and pretty white cheek and hip stripes). According to the NSW Department of Environment and Conservation they are now an endangered species: www.threatenedspecies.environment.nsw.gov.au/tsprofile/pr... Poor little things, they are by far the sweetest member of the kangaroo family I've ever seen :)

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: Sydney's Zoo opened in 1884 at Moore Park on the site of the current Sydney Boys'/Sydney Girls' High Schools until it moved to Taronga Zoo, Mosman, in 1916.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Here's an 1892 T&CJ article on the Moore Park prison...err... zoo - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71207774 ; remember William Blake's lines : 'A robin redbreast in a cage, puts all heaven in a rage'

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: Yes....gruesome. As seen in the Town & Country Journal article link, there were two "bear pits" and both have been preserved, though not complete. One near the canteen of Sydney Boys' High School, the other next to Anzac Parade within Sydney Girls' High School
